thread.title: The Oman Olympic Committee expects medal haul at GCC Games in Dammam
thread.title_full: The Oman Olympic Committee expects medal haul at GCC Games in Dammam

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: The Oman Olympic Committee expects medal haul at GCC Games in Dammam
text:
The Oman Olympic Committee expects medal haul at GCC Games in Dammam Muscat Daily staff writer October 12, 2015 
The Oman Olympic Committee (OOC) is expecting a notable haul of medals from the national teams and its athletes at the second GCC Games, which will be held in Dammam, Saudi Arabia from October 15-26. 
Speaking to Muscat Daily on Sunday, Sheikh Saif al Hosni, the OOC's vice-chairman, said, “We are sending a delegation of nearly 100 members. Oman will participate in nine disciplines and we expect the teams and the athletes to shine and bring home medals.” 
The OOC has approved the participation of national teams in athletics, swimming, handball, volleyball, endurance racing, camel racing, karate, bowling and weightlifting. 
Jihad al Shaikh, an OOC board member, said, “We have high expectations from our athletics and swimming teams.” 
The national volleyball team is already in Dammam, with the competition set to begin on Monday. The official opening of the Games will be held on Thursday. 
Said al Shahri, an OOC board member, will head the Omani delegation, while Khalid al Zubair, the OOC chairman, and Taha al Kishry, the OOC secretary-general, will attend the opening ceremony. Similar content
